description: An underwater forest on Fish-Man Island containing a ship graveyard and the grave of Queen Otohime. It also houses a Poneglyph containing Joy Boy's apology.

keyEvents.title: Robin Discovers Joy Boy's Apology on the Poneglyph
keyEvents.description: Nico Robin deciphers the Poneglyph in the Sea Forest, discovering it contains an apology letter from Joy Boy to the people of Fish-Man Island for failing to keep an ancient promise.
keyEvents.significance: The Sea Forest's Poneglyph reveals crucial information about Joy Boy and the Void Century, making this location central to One Piece's overarching mysteries.

keyEvents.title: Luffy and Jinbe's Disagreement Begins
keyEvents.description: Luffy and Jinbe's conflict over whether Luffy should fight Hody Jones escalates in the Sea Forest.
keyEvents.significance: The Sea Forest serves as the setting for the ideological clash between Luffy's loyalty and Jinbe's political concerns.

statusHistory.reason: The Sea Forest remains an important historical site on Fish-Man Island

description: The main plaza of Fish-Man Island, a central gathering place for citizens. It becomes the site where Hody Jones plans to execute King Neptune.

keyEvents.title: Announced as Execution Site
keyEvents.description: Hody Jones announces that Gyoncorde Plaza will be the site of King Neptune's execution in three hours, making it the focal point of his coup.
keyEvents.significance: Gyoncorde Plaza is designated as the stage for the climactic confrontation between the Straw Hats and the New Fish-Man Pirates.

description: An underwater island located beneath the Red Line, home to fish-men and merfolk. The island is currently under siege by Hody Jones and the New Fish-Man Pirates.

keyEvents.title: Hody's Island-Wide Broadcast
keyEvents.description: Hody Jones broadcasts his coup announcement across all of Fish-Man Island, declaring his takeover of the Ryugu Kingdom.
keyEvents.significance: The entire island becomes aware of Hody's coup, forcing all citizens to choose between compliance and resistance.

keyEvents.title: Citizens Forced to Desecrate Otohime's Memorial
keyEvents.description: Throughout Fish-Man Island, citizens are forced to step on portraits of Queen Otohime or face execution.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the island-wide oppression under Hody's coup and the rejection of Otohime's vision of peace.

statusHistory.reason: Inhabited island under threat from coup
